author: Tracy Heck
title: Diesel Concert Lounge celebrates 4th anniversary
text:
Diesel Concert Lounge celebrates 4th anniversary By: Tracy Heck AXS Contributor Feb 21, 2017 3 hours ago 199 199 16541761 7 y2017m02d21 114938 Tracy Heck 
Diesel Concert Lounge in Chesterfield celebrated its 4th anniversary with a huge show featuring some of the Detroit area's best local acts, as well as national favorites Sponge . 
The venue had music playing all night on both their lounge stage and the theater stage. The lounge stage included sets from Saints From Silence , Second Hand Smoke and Kougaran . 
Over at the main stage, George Aneed and The Law Abiding Citizens kicked things off with a bang and a rocking set that featured their own brand of funky rock, occasionally mixed in with a hip hop flavor. 
Next up was No Resolve , who drew the largest crowd of the evening. The band has been making waves with the recent release of their debut album Unity , making the Billboard Heatseeker Chart and winning Linkin Park's Stagelight Monthly Music Contest "Get Out," which went over well Saturday with their enthusiastic fans. 
No Resolve went on to play a number of tracks from the new album during their energetic set, including "What You Wanted." "The Pusher" and "What You Deserve." The tight five-piece certainly made an impression on all who made it out to the show. 
Sponge spent the evening shuttling fans on a 3-venue bus trip and were more than ready to party when they took the stage. They took requests from the crowd and kicked things off with a booming version of "Wax Ecstatic." 
They went on to pull out hits "Molly (16 Candles)", "Have You Seen Mary" and "Plowed" and also played newer track "The Whores Are Closing In," which is off their latest release, The Beer Sessions . 
After vocalist Vinnie Dombroski chatted with the crowd, the band also pulled out a fantastic version of The Ramone's "I Wanna Be Sedated" before heading out to the next venue. 
Diesel regulars, Cadre closed the evening out on the main stage with another fist-pumping set that included a passionate rendition of "Knowing That You're Gone", dedicated to the memory of vocalist Johnny Mascioli's uncle. 
They also pulled out fan favorites "Forever Chapter", "Treason" and "This Time Around." 
By: Tracy Heck AXS Contributor Feb 21, 2017 Added 3 hours ago Sponsor
